channel.title: Partitioning but not loosing files
channel.description: well I just freed up more space from my windows partition so I can have a big enough swap to accommodate my ram when going into hibernation. and I put my swap at beginning of this unallocated space, but I want to use the rest of this space(17 Gigs) for my linux partition. However, It only allows me to add on to the end, and not the the beginning. I do not want to loose all my files and have to reinstall EVERYTHING again, as the PSP toolchain can be annoying to set up. however it will not let me combine them... I would like to ultimately switch over to linux, however I can't get linux TV to work with my Tuner card, and sometimes I would like to record things when I am not at home. but anyway, is there a way to just Shift over everything and expand?

item.title: Partitioning but not loosing files
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

All sites will be closed down and the world will end as we know it. Yeah, when? Tongue When Venus and Mars again cross into a formation, and Mercury will shine over the earth and then fat people will dance with naked cats in the shower while mario and luigi ride mopeds into yougoslavia CantTouchThis93
Tomorrow?

Read full topic

item.title: Partitioning but not loosing files
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

That is what I used.
the only way I can see is by using a backup utility and save on disks or a remote folder, and dumping it back onto a bigger partition.
and an extended partition did not help at all…
what folders should I back up(I’ve already done usr, and etc, I am about to backup the home folder)
and is there a way I can preserve all my programs that I have installed, as that would be a VERY long time just to redownload EVERYTHING again…?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 04, 2008, 11:09:26 PM[/size][hr]well I notice you are online, but anyway I backed everything I could up, and now reinstalling the system. so it is kinda a bit late now
however I did screenshot the entire installed list so I know what I should get.

Read full topic

I’m not entirely sure what you are trying to do, but give gparted a shot.

item.title: Partitioning but not loosing files
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

well I just freed up more space from my windows partition so I can have a big enough swap to accommodate my ram when going into hibernation.
and I put my swap at beginning of this unallocated space, but I want to use the rest of this space(17 Gigs) for my linux partition. However, It only allows me to add on to the end, and not the the beginning. I do not want to loose all my files and have to reinstall EVERYTHING again, as the PSP toolchain can be annoying to set up. however it will not let me combine them…
I would like to ultimately switch over to linux, however I can’t get linux TV to work with my Tuner card, and sometimes I would like to record things when I am not at home.
but anyway, is there a way to just Shift over everything and expand?
